column4: Hello, I'm quite new with ubuntu (and linux in general) and would like to use one of my computers as a backup server
can i recommend rsyn - i have lots of guides if you need them
I need something which is easy to configure and maintain, i think that backuppc looked neat at the first glance
i am using rsyn with a cron job to do incremental backups daily
maybe you could give me some info about that solution,
i would like to be able to backup several pc's on this ubuntu server as well
should be fine - i run the job from my server and rsyn over ssh over the network
i use wake-on-lan to turn the other pcs on as well
that sounds very interesting to me
want linkage?
yes
can i easily see if my win-network-card supports wake-on-lan?
http://everythinglinux.org/rsync/
i just tried mine and it worked - you could see if it supports wakeonlan by lookin up the spec (mine was onboard and fine)
http://www.mikerubel.org/computers/rsync_snapshots/
i mounted over the network using sshfs but i think there are other ways
links for that - http://ubuntu.wordpress.com/2005/10/28/how-to-mount-a-remote-ssh-filesystem-using-sshfs/
http://www.debianadmin.com/ssh-your-debian-servers-without-password.html
I belive those guids will help me alot
I'll read them and see what i can come up wi
i was using them last night and they worked great for my basic needs
thanks very much
